channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Neighbour’s garden severely overgrown with Japanese knotweed, now impacting mine, 12th August
item.description:
Our neighbour refuses to maintain their garden, which has become severely overgrown with Japanese knotweed. The infestation has now spread into our garden, and we are once again facing the cost of professional treatment. This is not sustainable—the root cause must be addressed. We are requesting that the neighbour take immediate action to eradicate the knotweed at its source to prevent further damage and expense.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Imperial Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on Ewart road, 12th August
item.description:
Someone has left all this junk on the pavement. Can the council please come and collect?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ewart Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin sheds next to maisonettes, 12th August
item.description:
Litter strewn over the road from bin sheds next to the maisonettes- bin shed doors broken so constantly open - rat problem already
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10A, Otlinge Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive weeds growing on pavements and curbs, 12th August
item.description:
All along Garthorne Road and other surrounding roads weeds have taken over pavements and curbs! It makes our area look unkempt and run down. Seem to be paying more for the council to now do less?!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ewart Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive weed growth on pavements and road, 12th August
item.description:
Excessive weeds have cropped up in the last month or so across the area (not just here!). Pavements and curbs look a state and make the area look very unkempt and run down. In some cases this is causing obstruction on pavements, especially when navigating on bin day with a buggy!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ewart Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pavement and road, 12th August
item.description:
On Sumner Street, outside Sumner Buildings, there is a space for parking lime bikes but when that is full they are left all over the pavement and blocking the car parking spaces. This is dangerous for pedestrians. This is happening most days now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sumner Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Armchair and pallets, 12th August
item.description:
Large white chair has been there more than a week, three pallets added recently. On the corner by the Thomas Calton Centre.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Choumert Grove, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned pedal cycle, 12th August
item.description:
This is a second request for removal of a pedal cycle frame secured with a D lock to the cycle bay outside the Blackfen Community Library. Please can the necessary action be taken to remove this item. It has been reported to you under flytipping as the other category of abandoned cycles relate to rental bikes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfen Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12-14 Bonny Street NW1 9PG, 12th August
item.description:
Hello there are 2 drains in the gully that runs in front of a row of 5 houses on Bonny Street that are for run off and rain water and they are backed up and smelling. They should be draining to the main sewer and they are not so I think the main sewer is backed up. Thanks, Tristan
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Bonny Street, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle hangar wouldnt open, 12th August
item.description:
As of this week I can’t unlock the cycle hangar anymore. I have not received a new key so if the lock is changed then there has been no communication what so ever!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alexandra Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Mattress, 12th August
item.description:
2 dumped Mattresses between the bins indicated in the picture

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): City Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2bags of discarded food and growing piles of rubbish, 12th August
item.description:
2 bags of what looked liked defrosted food had been left on the roadside of the wall outside my balcony just dumped they didn’t bother to put them in the bin. And a growing pile of rubbish outside my balcony. When will something be done so that people use their own bins because everyone is dumping rubbish right outside my home every damn day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bag, 12th August
item.description:
12 bags of rubbish placed next to litter bin on Allsop Place opposite Madame Tussauds

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Allsop Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footballers are leaving their litter, 12th August
item.description:
Footballers congregating on main road opposite where I live and hang around making a lot of noise until after 11pm. The next day where they were is covered in discarded plastic bottles. I counted 8 today. Total lack of respect for our neighbourhood.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Conservancy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip, 12th August
item.description:
There has been furniture dumped next to the shutters on dunn street. Seems to be recent

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunn Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked chute 12 Matlock Court, 12th August
item.description:
This chute has been blocked for over a week, with really bad smells and attracting flies. Job raised 11286791/1, but has been ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris around traffic light islands, 12th August
item.description:
My previous report was ignored and marked’ no further action’. Action is required as would be seen if a proper inspection was carried out out . Please do not waste my time reporting such situations if you have no intention of taking action .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 186, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate weeding, 12th August
item.description:
Photos taken only days after last weeding. Very low standard. Contacts Officer Michael Henry has previously made site visits and agreed it's not up to standard - this is worse than in those occasions. And it is totally inadequate that wedding has not been carried out beneath and behind wheelie bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tunstall Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise level, 12th August
item.description:
Hello, I am writing to file a noise complaint regarding an event on Cresset Road on the evening of August 12, 2025. The event, organised by "Don't Stop Your Future," was excessively loud and disruptive, preventing peace in our homes. thank you, Irina

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cresset Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 12th August
item.description:
This manhole cover has been reported by multiple people and yet nothing has been done. The noise is unbearable as cars drive over it and I am pretty sure it's dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Boundary Lane, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
